(Bridel) Schimper in P. Bruch and W. P. Schimper

place_of_publication.publication_title: in P. Bruch and W. P. Schimper, Bryol. Europ.

bio:treatment.description: Plants large, in mats, reddish to brownish. Stems 4–10 cm, 3 mm wide, erect or ascending, sparingly branched. Leaves ± appressed when dry, erect-spreading when moist, straight, linear-lanceolate, strongly plicate, 3 mm; <base not decurrent>; margins plane, entire; apex slenderly long-acuminate; ecostate; basal laminal cells shorter than medial cells, golden brown; medial cells linear, 65–85 × 4–5 µm. Specialized asexual reproduction absent. Sporophytes unknown.
moist tundra soil granite limestone schist
bio:treatment.discussion: Orthothecium rufescens, like O. chryseum, is large and robust with distinctly plicate leaves, but can be distinguished by the reddish color and slenderly acuminate leaves.
